meanings.definition: Having a meaning that is mysterious or obscure
meanings.sent1: The cryptic message left us puzzled.
meanings.sent2: The detective tried to decipher the cryptic note.
meanings.sent3: The cryptic riddle made everyone scratch their heads.
meanings.sent4: Her cryptic smile hinted at a hidden agenda.
meanings.sent5: The cryptic symbols on the ancient artifact intrigued the archaeologists.

meanings.sent1: The spy sent a cryptic message to headquarters.
meanings.sent2: The cryptic language was difficult to crack.
meanings.sent3: The cryptic code protected the confidential information.
meanings.sent4: His cryptic writing style added an air of mystery to his novels.
meanings.sent5: The cryptic symbols on the map led to buried treasure.

meanings.sent1: The cryptic entrance to the cave was well-concealed.
meanings.sent2: She kept her intentions cryptic to surprise her friends.
meanings.sent3: The cryptic meeting took place under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent4: The cryptic location of the treasure remained a mystery for years.
meanings.sent5: The cryptic identity of the masked hero intrigued the townspeople.
